name: poi

a thick, soft food from Hawaii made from the root of a tropical plant that is crushed and then fermented (= changed by the action of bacteria): We lived off fish, fruit, and poi. You can pick up a bag of poi from the chilled counter.
More examplesFewer examplesThey have Hawaiian foods such as poi and saimin in their freezer section.The traditional Hawaiian dish of poi is made by steaming and pounding the taro root to a pulp.Poi is a Hawaiian dish of taro root pounded to a paste, often allowed to ferment.
